definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc
proportion of those present and voting
pinyin: chu1 xi2 biao3 jue2 bi3 li4

sentences.english: Afghanistan's Second Vice President Abdul Karim Khalili was present at the meeting as guest of the host country.
sentences.chinese: 阿富汗第二副總統哈利利作爲東道國客人出席會議。

sentences.english: Mr. Wang Runan, chairman of China Go Association attended the contest opening ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 中國棋院院長王汝南出席了開賽儀式。

sentences.english: She did not attend the hearing and was not represented in court.
sentences.chinese: 她沒有出席法院和參加聽證會，也未能向公報發言。

sentences.english: The morning session of the seminar was not well attended.
sentences.chinese: 這個研討會的晨會出席狀況不甚理想。

sentences.english: The political rally was souped up by the appearance of the candidates.
sentences.chinese: 這次政治集會由於各候選人的出席而顯得更爲熱鬧。
必定來出席我的壽辰宴會。

sentences.english: Pakistan"s Chief of Army Staff Gen Ashfaq Parvez Kayani was also present during the ceremony."
sentences.chinese: 巴基斯坦陸軍總參謀長也出席了授獎儀式。

sentences.english: H.E. Mr. Yang Youming, Chinese Ambassador to Trinidad and Tobago, and his wife Mrs. Geng Hailing were present.
sentences.chinese: 中國駐特多大使楊優明和夫人耿海凌出席。

sentences.english: The Chinese presidents have attended all the APEC informal leaders’ meetings.
sentences.chinese: 中國國家主席出席了歷次APEC領導人非正式會議。

sentences.english: Tanggu District, Vice Chairman of CPPCC Yang Zhigang attended the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 塘沽區政協副主席楊志剛出席會議。

sentences.english: This is the second such event I attended during my six months in London.
sentences.chinese: 這是我到任半年以來第二次出席中資機構的喬遷儀式。

sentences.english: Prof Wang Zihao, the president of BUCT hosted the welcome reception.
sentences.chinese: 王子鎬校長出席了歡迎晚宴並祝酒。

sentences.english: Become active in a professional association. This means doing more than paying dues and showing up for meetings.
sentences.chinese: 這就意味着，不再只是交交會費，出席一下會議。

sentences.english: A couple days ago she attended the P&G Communitys new product release press conference.
sentences.chinese: 前兩天她還剛剛出席了寶潔公司的一次新品發佈會。

sentences.english: She attended East Carolina University and earned an English degree.
sentences.chinese: 她出席東卡羅來納大學，並獲得英語學位。

sentences.english: China has sent her delegates to the conference.
sentences.chinese: 中國已派遣她的代表出席會議。

definition: to show oneself/to appear/(of a deity) to appear in the flesh

to strike a pose (Chinese opera)/(fig.) to make a public appearance/to come out in public (revealing one's true personality, opinions etc)/(of a product) to appear on the market or at a trade show etc
